title.rendered: India Women vs Thailand Women, Semi-final, Asia Cup: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Pitch Report

(Based on last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 77

2nd innings average score: 63

Type: Sluggish wicket. Helps slower bowlers.

Time: October 13, 8.30 AM IST

Teams

Probable XI for India: Shafali Verma, Smriti Mandhana (c), Sabbhineni Meghana, Jemimah Rodrigues, Richa Ghosh (wk), Kiran Navgire, Deepti Sharma, Pooja Vastrakar, Sneh Rana, Meghna Singh, Rajeshwari Gayakwad

Probable XI for Thailand: Nannapat Koncharoenkai (wk), Natthakan Chantham, Naruemol Chaiwai (c), Sornnarin Tippoch, Chanida Sutthiruang, Rosenan Kanoh, Phannita Maya, Nattaya Boochatham, Onnicha Kamchomphu, Thipatcha Putthawong, Nanthita Boonsukham

Game Changers

Richa Ghosh appears to be a safe pick in the wicketkeeper category. Besides adding 72 runs with the bat, she has inflicted 5 dismissals with the gloves.

When these two teams met earlier in the tournament, Sneh Rana generated 36 points for her spell of 4-0-9-3 and stormed into the Ultimate Team on My11Circle. In addition, she is a handy batter down the order, having a reputation for playing innings of substance when in trouble.

Smart Picks

Despite maintaining a low strike rate (83), Natthakan Chantham is the leading run-getter (116 at 19) for Thailand, including the highest score of 61.

Not far behind is Naruemol Chaiwai, who has accumulated 108 at 22. She has only one single-digit score in 5 games.

Barring the last game, Thipatcha Putthawong has struck in every other match, owing to which she is the highest wicket-taker (8) for her team.

Earlier in the competition, Rajeshwari Gayakwad added 20 vital points for her two-wicket haul against Thailand. Overall, she has taken 5 wickets.

Richa Ghosh appears to be a safe pick in the wicketkeeper category. Besides adding 72 runs with the bat, she has inflicted 5 dismissals with the gloves.

Power Players

With scores of 76, 75*, 2, and 35*, Jemimah Rodrigues is the highest run-getter for India. She has provided 140 fantasy points for her efforts.

90 runs in 3 innings, coupled with 10 wickets, including three two-wicket hauls has helped Deepti Sharma generate maximum points (200.5) for the tournament.

In her three opportunities, Smriti Mandhana has collected 70 runs. She is a big match performer, with a reputation for rising on the big stage.

Fantasy Tip of The Day

Thailand players have failed to consistently provide fantasy points. On the other hand, the Indians have played as a cohesive unit, and a combination of 7-4 in favour of India is likely to help you stay ahead in the race.
